verses.verse: A Song<WH7892> or Psalm<WH4210> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah,<WH7141> to the chief<WH5329> Musician<WH5329> upon Mahalath<WH4257> Leannoth,<WH6030> Maschil<WH4905> of Heman<WH1968> the Ezrahite.<WH250> O lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of my salvation,<WH3444> I have cried<WH6817> day<WH3117> and night<WH3915> before<WH5048> you:
Let my prayer<WH8605> come<WH935> before<WH6440> you: incline<WH5186> your ear<WH241> to my cry;<WH7440>
For my soul<WH5315> is full<WH7654> of troubles:<WH7451> and my life<WH2416> draws near<WH5060> to the grave.<WH7585>
I am counted<WH2803> with them that go<WH3381> down<WH3381> into the pit:<WH953> I am<WH1961> as a man<WH1397> that has no<WH369> strength:<WH353>

Free<WH2670> among the dead,<WH4191> like<WH3644> the slain<WH2491> that lie<WH7901> in the grave,<WH6913> whom<WH834> you remember<WH2142> no<WH3808> more:<WH5750> and they are cut<WH1504> off from your hand.<WH3027>
You have laid<WH7896> me in the lowest<WH8482> pit,<WH953> in darkness,<WH4285> in the deeps.<WH4688>
Your wrath<WH2534> lies<WH5564> hard<WH5564> on me, and you have afflicted<WH6031> me with all<WH3605> your waves.<WH4867> Selah.<WH5542>

You have put<WH7368> away<WH7368> my acquaintance<WH3045> far<WH7368> from me; you have made<WH7896> me an abomination<WH8441> to them: I am shut<WH3607> up, and I cannot<WH3808> come<WH3318> forth.<WH3318>
My eye<WH5869> mourns<WH1669> by reason<WH4480> of affliction:<WH6040> LORD,<WH3068> I have called<WH7121> daily<WH3605> <WH3117> on you, I have stretched<WH7849> out my hands<WH3709> to you.
Will you show<WH6213> wonders<WH6382> to the dead?<WH4191> shall the dead<WH7496> arise<WH6965> and praise<WH3034> you? Selah.<WH5542>
Shall your loving kindness<WH2617> be declared<WH5608> in the grave?<WH6913> or your faithfulness<WH530> in destruction?<WH11>
Shall your wonders<WH6382> be known<WH3045> in the dark?<WH2822> and your righteousness<WH6666> in the land<WH776> of forgetfulness?<WH5388>
But to you have I cried,<WH7768> O LORD;<WH3068> and in the morning<WH1242> shall my prayer<WH8605> prevent<WH6923> you.
LORD,<WH3068> why<WH4100> cast<WH2186> you off my soul?<WH5315> why hide<WH5641> you your face<WH6440> from me?
I am afflicted<WH6041> and ready to die<WH1478> from my youth<WH5290> up: while I suffer<WH5375> your terrors<WH367> I am distracted.<WH6323>
Your fierce wrath<WH2740> goes<WH5674> over<WH5674> me; your terrors<WH1161> have cut<WH6789> me off.
They came<WH5437> round<WH5437> about me daily<WH3605> <WH3117> like water;<WH4325> they compassed<WH5362> me about together.<WH3162>
Lover<WH157> and friend<WH7453> have you put<WH7368> far<WH7368> from me, and my acquaintance<WH3045> into darkness.<WH4285>
